marco_comments: This one looks like a bug in the parsing of mp4 files.
This is actually a bug, but a bug in the build system, not Firefox itself (should we consider them as bugs?)
This is a bug from the title, but it doesn’t have any patches attached and was closed in favor of another bug. So in practice it isn’t a bug.
This is in theory a bug, but a bug in an addon and not Firefox (as before, it doesn’t have patches attached).
This looks like a bug to me, probably the code that the patch is adding was wrongly removed before.
This is just adding a test for another bug.
This is a bug, but was fixed somewhere else (so probably shouldn’t be considered a bug, you’re right)
This is a bug to fix a failing assertion
This looks like a bug to me (the function should have been wrapped with those macros but wasn’t)
This is a user-interface bug
This is a test-only change
This is a bug because the function mentioned was not doing what it was supposed to do
This is a bug because something was not cleaned up properly
This is a user-interface bug
This is just a code style change
This is a bug (see comment 2, the person is giving steps to reproduce, etc.)
This is a bug (touch events not working well for some video elements)
This is adding some more error reporting
This is adding some null-checks (not because of a bug found in the wild, but for prevention)

This is a bug in how some URLs are interpreted (probably not a regression though, it’s probably never worked before)

This is a service worker bug

This is fixing an error that caused the compilation to fail
